ARABIC: لَا يَحْزُنُهُمُ ٱلْفَزَعُ ٱلْأَكْبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ هَٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The greatest terror will not upset them and the angels will welcome them: 'This is your Day, the one that you were promised.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will have safety from the mighty terror, and angels will receive them, (saying:) "This is your day which had been promised you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The Hour of the Great Terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them saying: "This is your Day which you had been promised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will not be affected by the great terror. The angels will come to them with this glad news: "This is your day which was promised to you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The greatest fear will not aggrieve them, and the angels will welcome them; saying “This is your day, which you were promised.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The greatest terror will not grieve them, and the angels will meet them, (with the greeting:) "This is your Day which you were promised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The great fearful event shall not grieve them, and the angels shall meet them: This is your day which you were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: the greatest terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them: 'This is your day that you were promised.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The Supreme Horror will not grieve them, and the angels will welcome them, (saying): This is your Day which ye were promised;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The great Horror [of the Day of Judgement] shall not grieve them, and the angels will welcome them, saying, "This is your Day which you have been promised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The Great Terror shall grieve them not, and the angels will meet them: this is Your Day which ye were ever promised-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The Great Terror will not upset them, and the angels will receive them [saying]: ‘This is your day which you were promised.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Great Terror will bring them no grief: but the angels will meet them (with mutual greetings): "This is your Day,- (the Day) that ye were promised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The greatest terror (on the Day of Resurrection) will not grieve them, and the angels will meet them, (with the greeting): "This is your Day which you were promised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The greatest terror shall not grieve them, and the angels will receive them: 'This is the Day you have been promised'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Supreme Fear will not worry them, and the angels will receive them: “This is your Day which you were promised.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:103] The Supreme Terror — which is that a servant be ordered off to the Fire, shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them, upon their exiting from their graves, saying to them: ‘This is your day, the one which you were promised’, during the [life of the] world.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The Supreme Horror) when the Fire will be closed and death is slaughtered between Paradise and hell (will not grieve them, and the angels will welcome them) at the gate of Paradise with the good news, ((saying): This is your Day which you were promised) in the life of the world; the verses (Lo! you and that which you worship beside [...] This is your Day which ye were promised) were revealed regarding 'Abdullah Ibn al- Zib'ari al-Sahmi, the Poet, and his dispute with the Prophet (pbuh) because of the idols.
